page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO HARPUR HILL
page.content:
{ Our area is directly to the south of the town of Buxton on the edge of the Peak District National Park.
The white cliffs of the limestone quarries in the south east and north west and north west can be seen for miles. The other landmark is { {Solomon's Temple,}a folly on one of the area's grassy hills. The main residential area -{Harpur Hill}- takes its name from one of them. In the 19th century Harpur Hill was a separate village but now a continuous line of houses link it to Buxton. It is an important part of the town; there are industrial estates, quarries and a Further Education College. However, most of the area is high, rough pasture land with few buildings.
